verbs.description: sf swankiest building [V: was] made to survive if city burned many beloved san francisco buildings have disappeared over the years from the original mission dolores to the city of paris department store to the old produce market but none was as rich in history as the montgomery block when the four - story granite building at washington and montgomery streets was torn down in 1959 the city most important link with the gold rush the vigilante days and the bohemian fin de siecle disappeared forever making the loss still more painful was the fact that this irreplaceable landmark was razed for that icon of modern progress a parking lot the montgomery block rose out of the ashes of the great fire of may 3 1851 the sixth and last of the fires that ravaged san francisco during the gold rush co chinese californios washington montgomery block england haraszthy partner san francisco portland france engineer james king union army army paris philadelphia montgomery editor kent timbers mark twain murder fin de siecle henry halleck east bay pisco punch charles caldwell dobie william california belgium tom sawyer adams portland timbers mission dolores bank exchange second vigilance committee idwal jones idwal jones academic south park
